intro: Quamoclit, commonly known as the "blue mist flower," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the genus Eupatorium in the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. Quamoclit is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique visual appeal.
